item.title: 中国打车公司滴滴出行必须面对美国投资者就首次公开募股提起的诉讼
item.description: 中国打车公司滴滴全球必须面对美国法院的诉讼，该诉讼称滴滴隐瞒并不服从中国政府的命令，推迟其 2021 年首次公开募股，直到解决网络安全和隐私问题为止，从而欺骗了投资者。【原文：Didi Global, the Chinese ride-hailing company, must face a lawsuit in a U.S. court claiming it defrauded investors by concealing and disobeying a Chinese government order to postpone its 2021 initial public offering until it resolved cybersecurity and privacy concerns.】

item.title: Smartsheet 收入前景不及预期，股价下挫
item.description: Smartsheet 周四发布的营收展望不及分析师预期，导致其股价下跌 10%，尽管这家云软件销售商的季度营收超过了预期。【原文：Smartsheet on Thursday provided a revenue outlook that missed analyst estimates, sending its stock down 10%, even after the cloud software seller's quarterly revenue exceeded estimates.】

item.title: 利洁时旗下公司在伊利诺伊州恩法米婴儿配方奶粉案中被判赔 6000 万美元
item.description: 伊利诺伊州的一个陪审团命令利洁时集团旗下的美赞臣公司向一名早产儿的母亲支付 6000 万美元，这名早产儿在服用该公司生产的 Enfamil 婴儿配方奶粉后因肠道疾病死亡。【原文：An Illinois jury has ordered Reckitt Benckiser unit Mead Johnson to pay $60 million to the mother of a premature baby who died of an intestinal disease after being fed the company's Enfamil baby formula.】

item.title: 早间新闻市场承压，关注中国房价
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 由于成本攀升，Ulta Beauty 的年度利润预期低于预期
item.description: Ulta Beauty 周四预测全年利润低于华尔街预期，因为供应链成本上升和促销活动增加损害了利润率，导致其股价在延时交易中下跌 4.5%。【原文：Ulta Beauty on Thursday forecast full-year profit below Wall Street estimates after elevated supply chain costs and increased promotions hurt margins, sending its shares down 4.5% in extended trading.】

item.title: Adobe 预测第二季度营收下滑
item.description: 本周四，Adobe 预测第二季度营收低于分析师预期，原因是在经济形势严峻的情况下，市场竞争激烈，对其集成人工智能的摄影、插图和视频软件的需求疲软。【原文：Adobe forecast second-quarter revenue below analysts' estimates on Thursday following stiff competition and weak demand for its artificial intelligence-integrated photography, illustration and video software amid a tough economy.】

item.title: 在对负利率终结的押注不断升温之际，外资纷纷涌入日本债券市场
item.description: 上周，外国投资者大幅增加了对日本债券的购买，因为人们越来越期待日本可能很快结束长期的负利率政策，并在今年开始加息。【原文：Foreign investors significantly increased their purchases of Japanese bonds last week amid growing expectation that Japan may soon end its long-standing negative interest rate policy and start increasing rates this year.】

item.title: 备忘录称美国银行整顿资本市场部门
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份备忘录，美国银行对其资本市场业务的领导层进行了数次调整，成立了一个名为资本市场咨询的新咨询小组，以期在动荡的宏观经济和地缘政治环境中更好地调整其产品。【原文：Bank of America has made several leadership changes in its capital markets business, setting up a new advisory group called capital markets advisory in a bid to better align its offering amid a volatile macroeconomic and geopolitical environment, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 亚马逊的 Zoox 机器人轴将在拉斯维加斯的夜间行驶得更快、更远
item.description: 亚马逊公司的自动驾驶汽车部门 Zoox 正在加利福尼亚州和内华达州扩大其车辆的测试范围，包括更广阔的区域、更高的速度和夜间驾驶，以求紧跟竞争对手 Waymo 的步伐。【原文：Amazon.com’s self-driving car unit, Zoox, is seeking to stay abreast of rival Waymo by expanding its vehicles’ testing in California and Nevada to include a wider area, higher speeds and nighttime driving.】

item.title: 解说：TikTok 会在美国被禁吗？
item.description: 美国众议院周三以压倒性多数通过一项法案，要求 TikTok 的中国所有者字节跳动在六个月内剥离该短视频应用在美国的资产，否则将面临全国范围的禁令。以下是对禁止该应用的努力、其在美国参议院的机会和实际意义的介绍。【原文：The U.S. House of Representatives overwhelmingly passed a bill on Wednesday that would give TikTok's Chinese owner ByteDance about six months to divest the U.S. assets of the short-video app, or face a nationwide ban. Here is a look at the effort to ban the app, its chances in the U.S. Senate and what that would actually mean.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Platinum Equity 正探讨以 20 多亿美元的价格出售 Club Car
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 Platinum Equity 已聘请顾问探讨出售 Club Car 的事宜，包括债务在内，这家高尔夫球车制造商的估值可能超过 20 亿美元。【原文：Private equity firm Platinum Equity has hired advisers to explore a sale of Club Car that could value the golf cart maker at more than $2 billion, including debt, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 微软指出谷歌在生成式人工智能领域的竞争优势
item.description: 微软向欧盟反垄断监管机构表示，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌凭借其数据宝库和人工智能优化芯片，在生成式人工智能领域享有竞争优势，这凸显了两大科技巨头之间的竞争。【原文：Alphabet unit Google enjoys a competitive edge in generative artificial intelligence due to its trove of data and AI-optimised chips, Microsoft has told EU antitrust regulators, underscoring the rivalry between the two tech giants.】

item.title: KKR 致力于在今年夏天敲定意大利电信网络交易
item.description: 美国基金 KKR 的一位发言人周四表示，KKR 正在加紧进行收购意大利电信（TIM）固网的准备工作，并与其他各方合作，力争在 2024 年夏季完成交易。【原文：KKR is pressing ahead with preparatory activities for the buyout of Telecom Italia's (TIM) fixed line network and working with other parties towards the summer 2024 timeframe for finalising the deal, a spokesperson for the U.S. fund said on Thursday.】

item.title: 意大利 Cucinelli 公司 2023 年息税前利润大增 39%，并确认了指导目标
item.description: 意大利奢侈品集团布鲁内罗-库奇内利（Brunello Cucinelli）周四表示，该集团去年的营业利润增长了 39.4%，并确认了 2024 年销售额增长约 10%的预期。【原文：Italian luxury group Brunello Cucinelli said on Thursday its operating profit rose 39.4% last year and it confirmed its expectations for sales growth of around 10% in 2024.】

item.title: 对冲基金经理因从教育科技初创公司挪用 5.33 亿美元面临逮捕
item.description: 一名美国破产法官周四下令逮捕威廉-卡梅隆-莫顿（William Cameron Morton），他是一名对冲基金经理，涉嫌帮助印度教育技术初创公司 Byju's 向贷款人隐瞒 5.33 亿美元的资金。【原文：A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Thursday ordered the arrest of William Cameron Morton, a hedge fund manager who allegedly helped Indian education technology startup Byju's hide $533 million from its lenders.】

item.title: 巴西地理统计局数据显示，巴西的屠宰记录使其成为全球肉类之王
item.description: 根据国家人口普查局周四公布的 2023 年数据，巴西肉类公司加工了前所未有的大量鸡肉和生猪，牛的屠宰量也创下了历史第二高水平。【原文：Brazilian meat companies processed unprecedented volumes of chicken and hogs and recorded the second-highest level of cattle slaughtering in history, according to 2023 data released on Thursday by the national census bureau.】

item.title: 独家报道花旗集团就欺凌指控对高级 IPO 银行家进行调查
item.description: 四位直接知情人士称，花旗集团正在调查至少一名员工对一位负责首次公开募股的美国高级银行家提出的工作场所骚扰指控。【原文：Citigroup is investigating workplace harassment allegations made by at least one employee against a senior U.S. banker who works on initial public offerings, four people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 马士基首席执行官称集装箱运价跌至不可持续水平
item.description: 马士基首席执行官文森特-克莱克（Vincent Clerc）周四在集团年度股东大会上表示，全球集装箱航运市场在未来几年将面临产能过剩，客户支付的运价已降至不可持续的水平。【原文：The global container shipping market faces overcapacity in the coming years and the rates paid by customers have fallen to an unsustainable level, Maersk CEO Vincent Clerc told the group's annual meeting of shareholders on Thursday.】

item.title: 塞拉俱乐部起诉美国证券交易委员会削弱气候风险披露规则
item.description: 一个大型环保组织提起诉讼，质疑美国证券交易委员会发布的要求上市公司报告气候相关风险的新规定，认为这些规定在保护投资者方面做得还不够。【原文：A major environmental group has sued to challenge new rules issued by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission requiring public companies to report climate-related risks, arguing they do not go far enough to protect investors.】

item.title: 上汽集团名爵汽车公司将于夏季开设第二个欧洲零部件中心
item.description: 中国汽车制造商上汽集团（SAIC）旗下的名爵汽车公司（MG Motors）发言人周四告诉路透社，该公司将于2024年夏季在法国开设第二个欧洲零部件中心，以满足法国日益增长的汽车需求。【原文：MG Motors, a unit of Chinese automaker SAIC , will open a second European parts centre by the summer of 2024 in France to meet the country's growing demand for its vehicles, a spokesperson told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 因帮派暴力，皇家加勒比暂停游轮访问海地拉巴迪
item.description: 周四，皇家加勒比集团的一位高级管理人员在 Facebook 上发帖称，由于海地数月来帮派暴力活动不断升级，该集团已在未来七天内暂停游轮访问海地的拉巴迪（一个僻静的半岛）。【原文：Royal Caribbean Group has suspended cruise visits to Labadee, a secluded peninsula in Haiti, for the next seven days following months of escalating gang violence in the country, a senior company executive said in a Facebook post on Thursday.】

item.title: 阿尔特里亚增加 24 亿美元股票回购，因出售百威英博股份而上调盈利预期
item.description: 阿尔特里亚集团（Altria Group）周四将其股票回购计划扩大了 24 亿美元，并上调了年度利润预期，此前这家万宝路（Marlboro）生产商同意出售其在啤酒生产商安海斯-布希英博（Anheuser-Busch InBev）所持有的约 10% 股份。【原文：Altria Group expanded its share buyback program by $2.4 billion and raised its annual profit forecast on Thursday, after the Marlboro maker agreed to sell about 10% of its stake in brewer Anheuser-Busch InBev .】

item.title: 摩根大通因交易报告不充分将支付近 3.5 亿美元罚金
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）周四宣布，摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co）被两家美国银行监管机构罚款 3.482 亿美元，原因是其监控公司和客户交易活动是否存在市场不当行为的计划不充分。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co has been fined $348.2 million by a pair of U.S. bank regulators over its inadequate program to monitor firm and client trading activities for market misconduct, the Federal Reserve announced Thursday.】

item.title: 资产管理公司称美股结算加速对欧洲构成 "系统性风险
item.description: 欧洲资产管理行业周四表示，华尔街将完成股票交易的时间缩短一半的举措将给欧洲带来 "系统性风险"，除非市场参与者有更多的时间来排队购买股票。【原文：Wall Street's move to halve the time it takes to complete a stock trade will create a "systemic risk" in Europe unless market participants get more time to line up dollars for stock purchases, Europe's asset management industry said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 1 月份商业库存保持不变
item.description: 由于零售商库存的增加被制造商和批发商库存的减少所抵消，1 月份美国商业库存出人意料地保持不变。【原文：U.S. business inventories were unexpectedly unchanged in January as increases in stocks at retailers were offset by declines at manufacturers and wholesalers.】

item.title: Zara 所有者 Inditex 因专注于数字化而削减中国门店
item.description: Zara 的所有者 Inditex 去年在中国的税前利润增长了一倍多，尽管这家时装零售商缩减了实体店的规模，关闭了其在中国五分之一的门店，这表明其对网络销售的重视正在取得成效。【原文：Zara-owner Inditex more than doubled its pre-tax profits in China last year even as the fashion retailer scaled back its physical presence, closing a fifth of its stores in the country in a sign its focus on online sales is bearing fruit.】

item.title: 受红海危机影响，Zara 所有者 Inditex 宣布延迟一周开业
item.description: 全球最大的服装零售商 Inditex 表示，由于红海危机，运载其产品的集装箱船避开苏伊士运河，绕道非洲南端，平均航运时间推迟了约一周。【原文：The world's biggest apparel retailer Inditex said average shipping times have been delayed by about a week by the Red Sea crisis, as container ships carrying its products avoid the Suez Canal and travel around the southern tip of Africa.】

item.title: 阿克豪斯与梅西百货就尽职调查进行谈判，以争取更高的出价
item.description: 梅西百货的投资者 Arkhouse Management 公司周四表示，该公司正在与投资公司商谈，以便对更高报价的前景进行尽职调查。【原文：Macy's investor Arkhouse Management said on Thursday the U.S. department store was in talks with the investment firm for opening its books for due diligence on the prospects of a higher offer.】

item.title: 纽约市广播公司在错过截止日期后向美国证券交易委员会提交年度报告
item.description: 纽约社区银行周四向美国证券交易委员会提交了年度报告，在错过监管机构规定的最后期限一个多星期后提交。【原文：New York Community Bancorp filed its annual report with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday, more than a week after missing the regulator's mandated deadline.】

item.title: 2024 年德国家用太阳能电池销售额将增长 26
item.description: 行业协会 BVES 周四表示，随着越来越多的家庭选择更便宜的可再生能源供应，用于在家中储存太阳能电力的电池今年在德国的销量可能会激增 26%。【原文：Sales of batteries to store solar electricity at home could jump by 26% in Germany this year as more households opt for cheaper and renewable energy supplies, industry association BVES said on Thursday.】
